Working from left-to-right if no digit is exceeded by the digit to its left it is called an increasing number; for example, 22344. Similarly if no digit is exceeded by the digit to its right it is called a decreasing number; for example, 774410 we shall call a positive integer that is neither increasing nor decreasing a “bouncy” 
number; for example, 155349.WAP to check whether a number is bouncy or not.

Input
The input consists of one number given as input at a time,the program checks if the number is bouncy or not.The number of test cases have to be specified in the first input.

Output
The output displays whether the number is bouncy or not,i.e it displays 1 when the number is bouncy and 0 when its not.
Input:
7
1
2
3
4
5
6
150

Output:
0
0
0
0
0
0
1
